Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class PersonalBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.PersonalBoard
public class PersonalBoard
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    PersonalBoard​(int i)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int countOfResources()
    get a total number of resources that the player has, used to get the victory points
    int countTotalCards()
    Method that count the number of development card on personal board
    int[][] DevelopMentSlotsStatus()
    method used by the PlayerUpdate class to generate a status of the DevelopmentCard Slots.
    int getBoardVictoryPoints()  
    int[] getCosts​(boolean[] productions)
    This methods returns an array representing the full resource cost of a production action The param is an array of boolean values, each true if the relative production action has been selected by the player index 0 contains DevCardSlot1, index 1 contains DevCardSlot2, index 2 contains DevCardSlot3, index 3 contains LeaderCard1, index 4 contains LeaderCard2
    int[] getCosts​(boolean[] productions, TypeOfResource type1, TypeOfResource type2)
    Overloading of the method with the same name, it has to be used when the base production action is selected The params are the same array of boolean values we saw before, and two types of resources type1 and type2 represent the cost of the base production action (they can be the same resource)
    FaithTrack getFaithTrack()  
    int getId()  
    int[] getNextPlaceableLevelOnSlots()
    returns an array stating which level of a development card can be placed on the slots
    DevelopmentCardSlot getSlot​(int slot)  
    Storage getStorage()  
    Strongbox getStrongbox()  
    int[] getTotalResources()
    This methods returns an array representing all the resources owned by a player in both his storage and his strongbox
    int numberOfDevelopmentCards()
    Counts the total number of cards in the 3 slots
    void setBoardVictoryPoints()
    changes the board victory points (equal to the total victory points the player has gained)
    void setBoardVictoryPointsIgnoreResources()
    Updates the board victory points but ignores the resources, this method is used during the game, where having more than 5 resources can change very fast during a turn, so it's useless to keep track of that value at the end of the game the setBoardVictoryPoints should be used instead
    boolean[] whereCanIPlaceTheCard​(int level)
    returns a boolean vector containing the slots where a card of a certain level can be placed

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getTotalResources

      public int[] getTotalResources()
      This methods returns an array representing all the resources owned by a player in both his storage and his strongbox

    • countTotalCards

      public int countTotalCards()
      Method that count the number of development card on personal board
      Returns:
      totCards, represent the the number of development card on personal board

    • getSlot

      public DevelopmentCardSlot getSlot​(int slot)

    • getId

      public int getId()

    • getCosts

      public int[] getCosts​(boolean[] productions)
      This methods returns an array representing the full resource cost of a production action The param is an array of boolean values, each true if the relative production action has been selected by the player index 0 contains DevCardSlot1, index 1 contains DevCardSlot2, index 2 contains DevCardSlot3, index 3 contains LeaderCard1, index 4 contains LeaderCard2

    • getCosts

      public int[] getCosts​(boolean[] productions, TypeOfResource type1, TypeOfResource type2)
      Overloading of the method with the same name, it has to be used when the base production action is selected The params are the same array of boolean values we saw before, and two types of resources type1 and type2 represent the cost of the base production action (they can be the same resource)

    • getBoardVictoryPoints

      public int getBoardVictoryPoints()

    • setBoardVictoryPoints

      public void setBoardVictoryPoints()
      changes the board victory points (equal to the total victory points the player has gained)

    • setBoardVictoryPointsIgnoreResources

      public void setBoardVictoryPointsIgnoreResources()
      Updates the board victory points but ignores the resources, this method is used during the game, where having more than 5 resources can change very fast during a turn, so it's useless to keep track of that value at the end of the game the setBoardVictoryPoints should be used instead

    • getFaithTrack

      public FaithTrack getFaithTrack()

    • getStorage

      public Storage getStorage()

    • getStrongbox

      public Strongbox getStrongbox()

    • DevelopMentSlotsStatus

      public int[][] DevelopMentSlotsStatus()
      method used by the PlayerUpdate class to generate a status of the DevelopmentCard Slots. Check the PlayerUpdate class to understand how the matrix is used in the view
      Returns:

    • getNextPlaceableLevelOnSlots

      public int[] getNextPlaceableLevelOnSlots()
      returns an array stating which level of a development card can be placed on the slots
      Returns:
      return an int[3], if the slot is full the int[i] will be 0, otherwise it's the next level placeable

    • countOfResources

      public int countOfResources()
      get a total number of resources that the player has, used to get the victory points
      Returns:
      total number of resources the player has (only the number)

    • whereCanIPlaceTheCard

      public boolean[] whereCanIPlaceTheCard​(int level)
      returns a boolean vector containing the slots where a card of a certain level can be placed
      Parameters:
      level - level of the card willing to be placed
      Returns:
      boolean vector containing as "true" the slots where the card is placeable

    • numberOfDevelopmentCards

      public int numberOfDevelopmentCards()
      Counts the total number of cards in the 3 slots
      Returns:
      total number of cards in the 3 slots
